column4: hey guys, is this correct to open port 6885: sudo iptables -A INPUT -p tcp --dport 6885 -j ACCEPT ?
i was asking about the iptables
if this is right sudo iptables -A INPUT -p tcp --dport 6885 -j ACCEPT
if something is actually listening there
yeah, exactly, locally... when i telnet to this port it just doesnt do anything
if you couldn't connect you'd get a "connection refused" immediately
im using putty to telnet to it and its not giving me connection refused, it just stays there in black
this is basicly it, it just doesnt do anything when i telnet, putty stays black without bringing anything up
not enough data to make a suggestion
putty is NOT a telnet client btw
well, it does telnet fine with other machines
you ever run an eggdrop before?
i ssh'd to ubuntu and tried to telnet from there, it does the same thing
